review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowSize: 256GBStyle: S25Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Needed to replace s9 which would not update anymore. Ordered s25 looking forward to new phone and being able to do what I wanted.  Boy!  Was I disappointed.  I do not need my phone to try to set a bathroom schedule for me, I can do that all on my own.  Don't need Bixby, AI, Cloud, or Google messaging.  Don't want the phone to try out think me. For God's Sake people Keep It Simple!!!!!  There are a lot of us older people out here that want basic equipment and a lot of us do not like Apple.  Anyway I probably will return the phone and see if I can get the S9 back on the air.

span: Raw photos not for professionals using Adobe software
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium BlackSize: 256GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: I am a professional artist: painter/illustrator/photographer. I use Adobe products like Photoshop. I was hoping to have a high quality camera on me at all times for photographing unplanned scenes and subjects (i.o.w. when I'm not lugging around my heavy Canon dslr and lenses). The jpegs this phone produces look fine in my Adobe products, (appear consistent with Samsung's Gallery app) and are acceptable quality for medium-sized prints, let's say 11x14. But for $1000+ I want the raw photos Samsung claims this phone can take. Once the photos get imported into Adobe apps, whether a mobile or desktop, it becomes apparent that the raw images are not really raw - they act like jpegs with a raw file ending. (I learned from researching, other users have found some third party apps can output the real raw images but those apps don't have access to all the camera hardware features. I did not feel this was an acceptable solution for such an expensive phone). Additionally the raw images appear terrible compared to their jpeg counterparts; they're extremely overexposed with odd color artifacts and pixelization, unusable as shot. This isn't acceptable for an artist with an existing workflow.

span: AI powered is not all it is cracked up to be.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium SilverblueSize: 512GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: The AI that "powers" this device is absolutely USELESS. It takes me twice as long to compose messages and write documents due to its horrific autocorrect methods. As a lifelong Galaxy fan, I find the decision to incorporate this AI extremely short sighted and it has crushed my faith in GOOGLE and SAMSUNG.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium SilverblueSize: 512GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Not worth the high price.  Battery life and faster charging  was my main reasons for wanting a new phone,  but it wasn't actually better than my older A15 Samsung! Also,  I don't like some of the features or functionality compared to my older Samsung but everything else that I use was exactly the same.  I ended up returning it because I couldn't justify paying that price for so little benefit.  It just didn't seem like an upgrade.  Luckily I hadn't traded in my older phone and I ended up adding an sd card to ease the storage burden on it.  I'll just keep my old one until they stop updating or it fully stops functioning and by that time this new version or similar will be a much better price.  A good reminder that new isn't always better and definitely over inflated in price. It's often more practical to wait.  I have better things to do with my money.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowSize: 256GBStyle: S25+Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Just unboxed Silver Shadow. Looks like industrial stainless steel. Very inelegant exterior design. Definitely the ugliest smartphone I have ever had. Will be finding an attractive cover asap. This sucker better offer amazing performance.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2025
review-text: What a let down especially for the price. Pictures from my note 10 plus we're so much better and easier. Huge disappointment that the poem cannot take a picture. I used that feature a lot with my not 10 plus. Hate this phone so far.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium BlackSize: 256GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: As a phone it's ok. If you plan to pair devices to it? Beware. There are problems with pairing. I should have looked it up before I bought this phone and I wouldn't have bought it.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: NavySize: 512GBStyle: S25+Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: En Marzo adquirí este celular Samsung Galaxy S25+  y desde q lo estoy usando tengo problemas de conexión, con datos mobiles la conexión es intermitente o para ser más específica tengo mínima conexión, pero con WiFi mejora un poco, inicialmente para ver si el problema se solucionaba procedí a cambiar mi chip porque el chip que tenía anteriormente era un poco antiguo, pero no funcionó y problema persiste, incluso mi chip en otro teléfono funciona sin problemas, pero con el celular nuevo presenta los inconvenientes mencionados, cabe recalcar que el problema es en todas las funciones, es decir, conexión a Internet, llamadas, etc.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: NavySize: 512GBStyle: S25+Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Ordered July 9.  After 5 talks with Amazon CS, finally got someone to send it to me.  Received one month later.  Sent to me loose in a box, one small flat piece of "stuffing".  No worries, it's just a $1K mini computer.  No need to mail safely. So far the phone works well.  Not that different from my previous one, SGS21+
